intro: Beilschmiedia donisii, commonly known as the Ecuadorian beilschmiedia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to the western slopes of the Andes in Ecuador, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and small, clustered white flowers that bloom during the wet season. Its fruits are bright red berries, which are an important food source for local wildlife. Beilschmiedia donisii is often found in lowland to montane forests, contributing to the biodiversity of its ecosystem.
